intro: Kunda, commonly known as *Korthandra balsamifera*, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. Kunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
